titles.title: Traveler Protection Act of 1993
To amend title 18, United States Code, to protect domestic and foreign tourists and other travelers in interstate and foreign commerce.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H6740)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E2505)
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 10/21/1993--Introduced. Traveler Protection Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide that whoever commits a crime of violence in a State against a victim who is not domiciled in that State shall be guilty of a like offense against the United States and subject to a like punishment in a Federal prosecution.
